lead_paragraph: Under new rules to be published on Tuesday, insurers will still be allowed to sell health plans with narrow networks of providers, but consumers will know in advance what they are getting.

headline.print_headline: Size of Health Care Networks Is to Become More Transparent Next Year
headline.main: Health Law Insurance Plans to be Rated by Network Size

snippet: Under new rules to be published on Tuesday, insurers will still be allowed to sell health plans with narrow networks of providers, but consumers will know in advance what they are getting.
abstract: Obama administration plans changes to Affordable Care Act in 2017 to address consumer complaints, including labeling health insurance plans based on size of networks; maximums for out-of-pocket costs will also be raised, worrying customers and critics.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
